zc.thread
Class SynchronousChannel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.SynchronousChannel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Channel
public class SynchronousChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Channel

Implements a synchronous message passing channel.

A SynchronousChannel, also known as a Rendez-Vous, connects two and only two threads; A single thread, the Sender, can send to the channel and a single thread, the Receiver, can receive from the channel; Communication is said to be one-to-one.

The first process, whether sender or receiver, to perform a channel operation is blocked until its partner perform the complementary operation. After a communication occurs, sender and receiver can proceed independently. This form of message passing is termed synchronous, since the sender and receiver must be exactly synchronized for communication to occur.

Another way of thinking of synchronous communication is that it implements a distributed assignment in which the sender's expression is assigned to the receiver's local variable.

Keep in mind that the ownership of the message object is transferred from the sender to the receiver. Consequently the sender should not access a message object after it has been sent through a Channel. If the sender need to reference a message object in the future it should copy it before sending it.

See Also:
Port

Method Detail

send

public void send(java.lang.Object inMessage)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Send a message through this Channel. The Sender is blocked until the message is received on the other side of this Channel.
Specified by:
send in interface Channel
Parameters:
inMessage - the message to send (null is not allowed).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inMessage is null.

receive

public java.lang.Object receive()
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait for a message from this Channel. The Receiver is blocked until a message is sent from the other side of this Channel.
Specified by:
receive in interface Channel
Returns:
an Object the message received (null object is not possible).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.
